intro: Echinocephalum lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf echinocephalum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, commonly known as the daisy or sunflower family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Echinocephalum lanceolatum is an annual or biennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various insects and small animals.
